text: Major League Cricket (MLC) has announced plans to expand the sport in the United States. The current six franchises will be joined by two new ones, as part of the league's ambitious expansion plans.

* Major League Cricket plans to expand to ten teams.
* The US T20 tournament is growing, with 34 games scheduled for 2025.
* The tournament is set to start in June, which is considered a "sweet spot" for the event.

Let me know if you'd like me to clarify anything!

**Tournament Details:**

* The ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024 will take place from June 1 to 29, 2024, across venues in the USA and West Indies.
* 45 MLC players will participate in the tournament, representing their national teams.

**MLC Recognition:**

* The ICC has granted Cognizant Major League Cricket List-A status, acknowledging it as an official T20 league.
* This recognition establishes MLC as the first high-quality domestic cricket tournament in the United States.

**MLC Teams and Players:**

* The six MLC teams are: Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom.
* The teams feature a mix of top-tier international and domestic cricketers, including players from the USA, West Indies, Bangladesh, South Africa, Australia, Ireland, Afghanistan, New Zealand, and Pakistan.

**Notable Players:**

* Some notable players participating in the T20 World Cup from MLC teams include Andre Russell, Shakib Al Hasan, David Miller, Josh Little, Nicholas Pooran, Rashid Khan, Kagiso Rabada, Trent Boult, Anrich Nortje, Romario Shepherd, Corey Anderson, Matt Henry, Josh Inglis, Sherfane Rutherford, Haris Rauf, Quinton de Kock, Heinrich Klaasen, Michael Bracewell, Ryan Rickelton, Obed McCoy, Imad Wasim, Mitchell Santner, Devon Conway, Aiden Markram, Daryl Mitchell, Naveen-ul-Haq, Marco Jansen, Akeal Hosein, Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head, Lockie Ferguson, and Rachin Ravindra.

* Willow by Cricbuzz, the official broadcaster of various cricket Boards and the home of the new Major League Cricket, has partnered with FuboTV to bring live cricket matches to subscribers.
* Through this partnership, subscribers of Fubo's International Sports Plus channel add-on package will have access to over 220 live cricket matches annually, including the ICC Men's T20 World Cup.
* The partnership aims to bring the excitement of cricket to new audiences and strengthen the cricket community across North America.

* 45 MLC players will participate in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024, representing various countries.
* The MLC consists of six teams: Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom.
* The tournament has been recognized by the ICC as an official T20 league, making it America's first world-class domestic tournament, with List-A status.
* The MLC has already made a significant impact on the cricket landscape in the USA, with the inaugural 2023 season being a huge success, drawing millions of viewers worldwide.
* The second season of the MLC is set to kick off on July 5.

* The MLC tournament is scheduled to start on July 5 and will clash with The Hundred for six days.
* The group stage will consist of 21 matches and will run until July 23, with each team playing 7 group fixtures.
* The knockout stage will begin on July 24, featuring four out of the six franchises, with the following schedule:
  - July 24: Eliminator
  - July 25: Qualifier
  - July 26: Challenger
  - July 28: Final

* There are plans to launch a new women's T20 franchise tournament in the United States, which would aim to attract top global players and potentially run alongside the existing men's franchises in the MLC.
* The idea is still in its early stages, but key figures in American cricket are eager to leverage the opportunity presented by the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics and the success of the inaugural MLC men's T20 tournament.
* Owners of several MLC franchises, including the Ambani family who own MI New York, have shown interest in developing women's teams.
* The initiative could significantly enhance the profile and earnings of women's cricketers worldwide and potentially impact the international schedules of England's women cricketers.

Note: There is no specific information about the 2023 MLC tournament schedule, teams, or players in this article. The focus is on the potential launch of a women's T20 franchise tournament in the USA.

**Dates and Schedule:** The MLC 2024 tournament will take place from July 5 to 28, 2024.

**Venues:** The tournament will be hosted across two venues: Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina, and Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas.

**Teams:** Six teams will participate in the tournament: MI New York, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, LA Knight Riders, San Francisco Unicorns, and Washington Freedom.

**Format:** The teams will play 21 matches in a round-robin format, with each team facing every other team once. The top four teams will advance to the playoffs, which will include an eliminator, qualifier, and final matches.

**Playoff Schedule:**

* Eliminator: July 25, 5:00 AM IST, Grand Prairie Stadium
* Qualifier: July 26, 5:00 AM IST, Grand Prairie Stadium
* Challenger: July 27, 5:00 AM IST, Grand Prairie Stadium
* Final: July 29, 5:00 AM IST, Grand Prairie Stadium

**Expansion:** The MLC is planning to expand to a 10-team setup in the near future, with two new teams set to be added in the next few seasons.

**Teams and Ownerships:**

* MI New York: Owned by Mumbai Indians
* Seattle Orcas: Linked with Delhi Capitals
* Texas Super Kings: Associated with Chennai Super Kings
* LA Knight Riders: Owned by Kolkata Knight Riders
* San Francisco Unicorns: Includes New Zealand's Finn Allen and other international talents
* Washington Freedom: Coached by Australian legend Ricky Ponting

Major League Cricket (MLC) has reached an exclusive negotiating agreement with Irvine, California to build a cricket venue on a 15-acre parcel of Great Park. The planned stadium would have a capacity of 10,000, which can be expanded for major international events. The venue is intended to be the home of an MLC team.

* David Miller has signed with the Los Angeles Knight Riders for the upcoming MLC season.
* The MLC season will take place after the T20 World Cup.
* Aiden Markram has signed with the Texas Super Kings, where he will be teammates with former Proteas captain Faf du Plessis.
* Nandre Burger has signed with the Seattle Orcas.
* Anrich Nortje has signed with MI New York.
* The Texas Super Kings reached the play-off stage in the inaugural edition of MLC in 2023.
* The Seattle Orcas finished in second place in the inaugural edition of MLC in 2023, losing to MI New York in the final.
* The article also mentions that David Miller previously played for the Texas Super Kings in MLC.

**Expansion Plans:** MLC announces plans to expand from 6 franchises to 8 in the near future and eventually to 10 teams.

**List A Status:** MLC has been awarded List A status by the International Cricket Council, recognizing it as an official T20 league and America's first world-class domestic tournament.

**Season Expansion:** MLC CEO Vijay Srinivasan plans to expand the season from 19 games in 2023 to 34 games by 2025.

**Schedule:** The second season will start at the end of the men's T20 World Cup and run for 23 days, overlapping with The Hundred. MLC aims to start its season in early June, creating a window from June to July.

**Implications:** The expansion plans may have significant implications for the professional cricket landscape in England, potentially clashing with the T20 Blast season and influencing the decision on private investment in The Hundred.

**Development:** MLC has established academies and a minor league system to develop local players and is working on developing more List A venues, aiming to build a robust cricket infrastructure in the US.

**Ambitions:** The ultimate goal is to have a strong USA cricket team, with a larger pool of players, a home-and-away format, and a robust set of venues around the country.

**Launch and Investors**: The MLC was launched in 2022 with an investment of $120 million from investors including Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella, Shah Rukh Khan, and others.

**First Season**: The first season of MLC was played in July 2023 with 6 teams, all owned by Indian investors. The season consisted of 15 group-stage matches and 4 playoff matches, with MI New York winning the title. Nicholas Pooran was the highest run-scorer, and Trent Boult took the highest number of wickets.

**Upcoming Second Season**: The second season of MLC will start on July 6, with 21 group-stage matches and 7 matches per team. The matches will be played in two stadiums, and the timing will be adjusted to attract more fans.

**Challenges**: MLC faces challenges in competing with the Indian Premier League (IPL), with a significant difference in brand value and player salaries. To succeed, MLC needs to improve the quality of American players.

**International Recognition**: The International Cricket Council approved List-A status for MLC, allowing player and team statistics to be counted in T20 records.

**Future Plans**: The MLC plans to increase the number of matches to 34 by 2025 and eventually become a 10-team tournament, a first for any franchise tournament outside of the IPL.

**Tournament Details:**

* The second season of the Major League Cricket will begin on July 5, 2024, and the final will take place on July 28, 2024.
* Six teams are participating in the tournament: MI New York, Texas Super Kings, LA Knight Riders, Seattle Orcas, Washington Freedom, and San Francisco Unicorns.

**Key Fixtures:**

* The tournament will start with Defending champions MI New York taking on Seattle Orcas on July 5, followed by Texas Super Kings taking on LA Knight Riders in Texas.
* The fixture schedule includes 17 matches, with the top four teams qualifying for the playoffs.
* The playoffs will consist of an Eliminator (July 24), a Qualifier (July 25), a Challenger (July 26), and the Championship Final (July 28).

Note: All matches will be played at either Church Street Park or Grand Prairie Stadium.

* The second season of the Major League Cricket (MLC) is set to begin on July 5th, with the finals scheduled for July 28th.
* David Miller, a South African star batter, has signed with the LA Knight Riders for the upcoming season.
* The LA Knight Riders, led by Sunil Narine, finished last in the table with 2 points from five matches in the previous season.
* The team's first game of the season is against the Texas Super Kings.
* Notable players in the LA Knight Riders team include Shakib Al Hasan, Jason Roy, Ali Khan, Spencer Johnson, Adam Zampa, and Andre Russell.
* This is the second season of the MLC, following a successful first season where MI New York won the title by beating Seattle Orcas in the finals by 7 wickets.
